title: Calculation of results for Po-210 in water by alpha spectrometry

author: Marko Štrok, Reaktorski center, Institut "Jožef Stefan"

segmentation: Hello, my name is Marco and in this part you will learn how to calculate results for the termination of polonium 210 in water samples by Alpha spectrometry.
As a result of measurements, we have polonium spectrum with isotopes polonium 210 and polonium 209.
Volume 209 is used as a tracer for tracing radiochemical recovery.
For the calculation of the results we will need pick area or number of events recorded in each peak, since that correspond to the activity concentration of each radiant light of interest.
Results of polonium 210 activity concentration in water samples can be calculated using this simple equation 1.
In the equation we have on top background, subtracted polonium 210 count rate.

Which we multiply by the polonium 209 activity concentration which is known from all standard, and then we divide it, but the background subtracted polonium 209 contrate mass of edit .109 standard and volume of the sample.
Count rate is calculated to decoration 2 by division of number of counts that this number of events in the peak area for specific radionuclide divided by measurement time.
For each of the results we have to calculate measurement and certainty using consultant propagation loss.
Each of the elements in equation 1 used to calculate or measurement have an uncertain T. In Equation 3, first term in brackets is showing relative standard uncertainty of background subtracted.
Polonium 209 count rate, second term, relative standard or certainty of background subtracted polonium to conduct 9 count rate.
3rd relative standard for certainty of activity.
Concentration of polonium 209.
Tracer next is Rajasthan after certainty of mass of added tracer and the last one is relative standard for certainty of volume of the sample.
Standard or certainties of background subtracted count rates can be calculated using equations.
Four and five were standard certainty of the count rate is calculated as pazan distribution as one divided by the square root of number of counts as shown in equation 6.
Standard 34.209 tracer we can get from the certificate complaining distressor were standard or certainty of the mess and volumes depend on used balance and volume measuring cylinder.
When we report results, we usually multiply combined center certainty by the coverage factor to get expanded to certainty as shown in equation 7.
Usually we take coverage factor of two, which represents that there is 95% probability that the true value lies within our measured value plus minus expenditure certainty.
Finally, we report, so results as activity concentration plus minus expanded the certainty.
We can also provide which coverage factor is used.
